intro: Seseli macedonicum, commonly known as Macedonian seseli, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbel-shaped inflorescences. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in mountainous areas. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some parts of its range.
